intro: Casearia austroafricana, commonly known as the African casearion, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. The plant is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in moist, shaded environments in its native habitat.
